Header.IT: Il servizio di telemetria
Livello di raccolta dati del sistema operativo

Description.IT: Utilizzando Windows, il dispositivo invia a Microsoft dati necessari per mantenere il sistema sicuro, aggiornato e funzionante.

Header.IT: Windows Error Reporting

Description.IT: Il servizio di segnalazine degli errori permette agli utenti di segnalare a  Microsoft i crash delle app e del kernel, cosicchè vengano fornite soluzione ai problemi riportati.

Header.IT: Frequenza feedback

Description.IT: Frequenza richiesta feedback da parte di windows.

Header.IT: Operazioni pianificate di raccolta dati

ChildDescription.IT: Colleziona dati sui programmi se si aderisce al Microsoft Customer Experience Improvement Program.
Questo processo collezziona ed invia i dati autochk SQM se si aderisce al Microsoft Customer Experience Improvement Program.
Se si aderisce Windows Customer Experience Improvement Program, questo processo colleziona e invia dati d'utilizo alla Microsoft.

Il processo USB CEIP (Customer Experience Improvement Program) colleziona dati relativi all'USB ed informazioni sul dispositivo e li invia al team  Windows Device Connectivity engineering  della Microsoft. Tali informazioni servono per migliorare il funzionamento dell'USB in Windows. Se l'utente non participa al programma Windows CEIP, questo processo non fà nulla.
Il report diagnostico sul disco raccoglie informazioni generali sul disco e sul sistema alla Microsoft per gli utenti partecipanti al Customer Experience Program.
Questo processo mostra (?) various Map related toasts.
Questo processo aggiorna le mappe offline. Disabilitandola from non ti notificherà gli aggiornamenti delle mappe.
Avvia il monitoraggio di Family Safety.
Il processo standbay di XblGameSave, che sincronizza i progressi nei videogiochi quando il sitema è inutilizzato.

Header.IT: Usa le credenziali per configurare automaticamente il dispositivo dopo gli aggiornamenti

Description.IT: Alcuni aggiornamenti richiedono il riavvio del PC ed il log-in in Windows per completarne l'istallazione, quindi potresti non essere in grado di usare il dispositivo fino alla fine dell'istallazione. Windows previene questo creando un token che permette a windows di accedere automaticamente. Dopo la fine dell'installazione il tuo account verrà disconnesso per mantenere le informazioni al sicuro.

Header.IT: Permetti ai siti web di fornire contanuti più rilevanti accedendo alla lista delle lingue installate
Permetti alle app di mostrarmi pubblicità personalizzate usando il mio id pubblicitario
Mostra la Windows welcome experiences dopo gli aggiornamenti e in occasione di nuove funzionalità o promozioni

Description.IT: Windows potrebbe mostrare un pop-up per farti scoprire's le novità del sistema operativo.

abilita l'istallazione automatica delle app consigliate

Description.IT: Windows può scaricare e installare silenziosamente alcune app suggerite da Microsoft Store senza alcuna conferma dell'utente.

Description.IT: In Windows, dopo aver completato la configurazione su una nuova installazione o aggiornamento o quando si accede a un nuovo account, visualizza il "Animazione primo accesso"che presenta diversi messaggi per configurare l'ambiente dell'account.

Header.IT: Impostare la qualità degli sfondi desktop JPEG a

Description.IT: Quando si imposta un'immagine JPEG come sfondo del desktop o come presentazione, il sistema operativo riduce la qualità dell'immagine originale all'85% e lo memorizza come file TranscodedWallpaper nella cartella \ N% AppData% \ Microsoft \ windows \.Se si utilizza un'immagine PNG come sfondo del desktop  o come slideshow, non sei interessato da questa riduzione automatica della qualità poiché si applica solo alle immagini JPEG.

Sensore di memoria

Description.IT: Senso di memoria viene eseguito quando lo spazio su disco è basso. Pulisce abbastanza spazio per aiutare il tuo sistema a funzionare meglio.

Header.IT: Esegui il sensore di memoria.

Description.IT: Sensore di memoria si esegue quando lo spazio su disco è basso e libera spazio sufficiente per un funzionamento ottimale del sistema operativo.È meglio creare l'attività \
nella sezione \
per ripulire windows in modo più efficace.

ChildHeader.IT: Se lo spazio libero su disco libero

Header.IT: Elimina file temporanei che non sono utilizzati dalle app
Ibernazione

Description.IT: Ibernazione è uno stato di risparmio energetico utilizzato principalmente per laptop. A differenza della sospensione, l'ibernazione mette i documenti e i programmi aperti sull'unità di sistema nel file C: \ hiberfil.sys e spegne il computer. Per impostazione predefinita, la dimensione del file protetto del sistema nascosto C: \ hiberfil.sys è il 40% della quantità totale di RAM installata. Disabilitare l'ibernazione disabiliterà anche l'avvio rapido e l'ibernazione non verrà più visualizzato nel menu di alimentazione.Non è consigliato spegnerlo sui dispositivi mobili.

Header.IT: Il percorso variabile dell'ambiente temp

Description.IT: Utilizzare Solo nel caso in cui si sia l'unico utente su questo PC, altrimenti tutti gli utenti utilizzeranno la stessa cartella per tutti i file temporanei.

Header.IT: Abilita il limite di carattere del percorso a 260

Description.IT: Per impostazione predefinita, il limite massimo di lunghezza del percorso in Windows è 260 caratteri. Un percorso locale è strutturato nel seguente ordine: Lettera di unità, due punti, barra, nome cartell separati da barre indietro e un carattere null terminale.

Header.IT: Display Codice di errore quando si verifica un BSOD

Description.IT: Per impostazione predefinita, Windows non visualizza un codice di errore quando si verifica un BSOD, che aiuterebbe a identificare le cause di un BSOD.

Header.IT: Scegliere quando si verrà avvisato di modifiche al tuo computer

Description.IT: When User Account Control (UAC) is enabled, Windows prompts for consent or prompts for credentials of a valid local administrator account before starting a program or task that requires a full administrator access token. This prompt ensures that no malicious software can be silently installed or run.

ChildHeader.IT: Notify me only when apps try to make changes to my computer

ChildDescription.IT: With this setting enabled, your desktop will be dimmed when you get an elevation request by the User Account Control (UAC) prompt.
With this setting enabled, your desktop will never be dimmed when you get an elevation request by the User Account Control (UAC) prompt.

Header.IT: Enable access to mapped drives from app running with elevated permissions with Admin Approval Mode

Description.IT: Enabled UAC with the default settings does not allow access to mapped network drives from applications running in administrator mode. This means that if you run the command line or a file manager with elevated privileges, they will not show the drive letters of the mounted network folders.

Header.IT: Enable downloading updates with delivery optimization

Description.IT: Windows Update Delivery Optimization works by letting you get Windows updates and Microsoft Store apps from sources in addition to Microsoft, like other PCs on your local network, or PCs on the Internet that are downloading the same files. Delivery Optimization also sends updates and apps from your PC to other PCs on your local network or PCs on the Internet, based on your settings. Sharing this data between PCs helps reduce the Internet bandwidth that's needed to keep more than one device up to date or can make downloads more successful if you have a limited or unreliable Internet connection.

Header.IT: Always wait for the network at computer startup and logon for workgroup networks

Description.IT: To reduce login time Windows does not wait for the network to be fully initialized at startup or login. Policy settings apply asynchronously when the computer starts and when the user signs in. As a result operating system does not wait for the network to be fully initialized at startup and sign-in. Existing users are logged on by using cached credentials. This reduces log-in times. Group Policy is applied in the background after the network becomes available.

Header.IT: Let Windows manage my default printer

Description.IT: By default, Windows make the last used printer as the default one.

Header.IT: Receive updates for other Microsoft products

Description.IT: Get Microsoft Office and other updates together with Windows updates.

Header.IT: Choose the power plan

ChildDescription.IT: It is not recommended to turn on the "High performance" power scheme on laptops.

Header.IT: Use the latest installed .NET Framework runtime for all apps

Description.IT: If an app requires the legacy .NET Framework 2.0, 3.0, or 3.5 to be installed, enabling this feature will force the application to use the latest installed .NET Framework version.

Header.IT: Allow the computer to turn off the network adapters to save power

Description.IT: It is not recommended to turn off the network adapters to save power on laptops.

Header.IT: Override for default input method
Select folder to save screenshots when pressing Win+PrtScn

Description.IT: Select the "Desktop" if you choose to remove OneDrive only (or it was uninstalled before), otherwise the backup functionality for the "Desktop" and "Pictures" folders in OneDrive breaks.

Header.IT: Recommended troubleshooting

Description.IT: Microsoft can recommend and run troubleshooters to fix issues. How much do you want Microsoft to help when there are issues on your device that troubleshooters might be able to fix?

ChildDescription.IT: In order this feature to work the OS level of diagnostic data gathering will be set to "Optional diagnostic data", and the error reporting feature will be turned on.
In order this feature to work the OS level of diagnostic data gathering will be set to "Optional diagnostic data", and the error reporting feature will be turned on.

Header.IT: Launch folder windows in a separate process

Description.IT: By default, all Esplora file windows, including the desktop shell, run in a single explorer.exe process. If one Esplora file window hangs or crashes, it will cause the whole graphical shell to freeze until the process restarts. When enabled, each explorer.exe process will have its own process ID (PID) to improve stability of the explorer shell.

Header.IT: Enable reserved storage

Description.IT: To make sure your device can successfully update and that it runs its best, Windows reserves a portion of storage space on your device for use by temporary files, caches, and other files. When your device is low on space, Windows will clear reserved storage so it can be used for other processes, like a Windows update. Reserving storage also helps keep disk space usage on your device more predictable and more stable. After disabling the reserved storage will be deleted after the next update installation.

Header.IT: Enable help look up via F1
Enable Num Lock at startup
Enable Caps Lock
Keyboard shortcut for Sticky keys

Description.IT: Press the Shift key 5 times to turn Sticky keys on or off

Header.IT: Use AutoPlay for all media and devices
Enable thumbnail cache removal

Description.IT:
Windows deletes automatically thumbnail cache after restart or shutdown, and Esplora file has to re-create thumbnails again. The thumbnail cache is stored as .db files located in the hidden 
%LOCALAPPDATA%\Microsoft\Windows\Explorer folder.

Header.IT: Restart apps after signing in

Description.IT: Automatically save my restartable apps and restart them when I sign back in. If the program was run as administrator in the previous session, it will be restarted with non-admin permissions.

Header.IT: Enable "Network Discovery" and "File and Printers Sharing" for workgroup networks
Automatically adjust active hours for me based on daily usage
Restart as soon as possible to finish updating
Default terminal app

Description.IT: Set Windows Terminal as default terminal app to host the user interface for command-line applications.

Header.IT: Uninstall the "PC Health Check" app

Description.IT: The KB5005463 update installs the "PC Health Check" app to check if PC meets the system requirements of Windows 11.

Header.IT: Install the latest Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable Packages 2015–2022 x64

Description.IT: The Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable Packages 2015–2022 x64 will be downloaded from the Microsoft resource (the internet connection required) and installed silently. Visual Studio versions since Visual Studio 2015 share the same redistributable files.

Header.IT: OneDrive
Show recently added apps in the Start menu
Show app suggestions in the Start menu
Run the Windows PowerShell shortcut from the Start menu as Administrator
Download and install the HEVC video codec (H.265)

Description.IT: The codec allows you to open images and videos in .heif and .hevc formats, respectively.

Header.IT: Autostart Cortana
Enable Microsoft Teams autostarting
Xbox Game Bar

Description.IT: To prevent popping up the "You'll need a new app to open this ms-gamingoverlay" warning, you need to disable the Xbox Game Bar app, even if you uninstalled it before.

Header.IT: Xbox Game Bar tips
Hardware-accelerated GPU scheduling

Description.IT: With the right hardware and drivers, Windows can offload most of GPU scheduling to a dedicated GPU-based scheduling processor. With the Hardware-Accelerated GPU Scheduling feature, the GPU's scheduling processor and memory (VRAM) takes over the same work and runs it in batches to render the frames. In that way, your GPU relieves the processor from some work and reduces latency to potentially make your PC run better.

Header.IT: Windows Cleanup

Description.IT: Create the "Windows Cleanup" scheduled task for cleaning up Windows unused files and updates under the SophiApp folder in the Task Scheduler. A native toast notification will be displayed where you can choose to snooze, run the cleanup task or dismiss.

Header.IT: Сlean up the Windows Updates download folder

Description.IT:
Create the "SoftwareDistribution" scheduled task for cleaning up 
%SystemRoot%\SoftwareDistribution\Download, where all Windows updates are downloaded to, under the SophiApp folder in the Task Scheduler. The task will wait until the Windows Updates service finishes running. The task runs every 90 days.

Header.IT: Clean up the temporary folder

Description.IT: Create the "Temp" scheduled task for cleaning up the temp folder under the SophiApp folder in the Task Scheduler. Only files older than one day will be deleted. The task runs every 60 days.

Header.IT: Enable Microsoft Defender Exploit Guard network protection

Description.IT: Network protection helps to prevent users from using any application to access dangerous domains that may host phishing scams, exploits, and other malicious content on the internet.

Header.IT: Enable detection in Microsoft Defender for potentially unwanted applications and block them
Enable sandboxing for Microsoft Defender

Description.IT: Running Microsoft Defender in a sandbox ensures that in the unlikely event of a compromise, malicious actions are limited to the isolated environment, protecting the rest of the system from harm. The sandbox for Microsoft Defender is enabled by default in Windows 11.

Header.IT: Enable events auditing generated when a process is created or starts

Description.IT: Enable logging of each app execution, who the app ran as and the process that started this process (event 4688). You can correlate this event to other events by Process ID to determine what the program did while it ran and when it exited (event 4689).

Header.IT: Include command line in process creation events

Description.IT: It will be possible to read the command line arguments for any successfully created process (event 4688). In order for this functionality to work, events auditing will be enabled.

Header.IT: Create the "Process Creation" Custom View in the Event Viewer

Description.IT: The "Process Creation" Custom View is designed to filter running processes and their arguments for better system security auditing. In order for this functionality to work, event and command line auditing in process creation events will be enabled.

Header.IT: Enable logging for all Windows PowerShell modules

Description.IT: Pipeline execution events for members of the specified modules are recorded in the Windows PowerShell log in the Event Viewer. For the built-in Windows PowerShell 5.1 only

Header.IT: Enable logging for all PowerShell scripts input to the Windows PowerShell event log

Description.IT: Windows PowerShell will log the processing of commands, script blocks, functions, and scripts - whether invoked interactively, or through automation to the "Applications and Services Logs\Microsoft\Windows\PowerShell\Operational" event log. For the built-in Windows PowerShell 5.1 only.

Header.IT: Check apps and files within Microsoft Defender SmartScreen
Mark files that have been downloaded from the Internet as unsafe

Description.IT: The Attachment Manager is included in Windows to protect from unsafe files downloaded from the Internet. If the Attachment Manager identifies an attachment that might be unsafe, the Attachment Manager prevents (blocks) you from opening the file, or it warns you before you open the file. The metadata is saved as an Alternate Data Stream (ADS). If you wish to unblock a downloaded file manually, you can do so by right-clicking it, selecting Properties and clicking on "Unblock".

Header.IT: Enable Windows Script Host

Description.IT: Disabling this feature blocks the execution of .js and .vbs scripts, preventing malicious JavaScript scripts from running.

Header.IT: Windows Sandbox

Description.IT: Windows Sandbox provides a lightweight desktop environment to safely run applications in isolation. Software installed inside the Windows Sandbox environment remains sandboxed and runs separately from the host machine. A sandbox is temporary. When it's closed, all the software and files and the state are deleted. You get a brand-new instance of the sandbox every time you open the application. Doesn't work in Home Edition.

Header.IT: The "Extract all" item in the Windows Installer (.msi) context menu

Description.IT: The "Extract all" context menu item will extract all contents of the .msi file into the "Extracted" folder at the same location as .msi file is.

Header.IT: The "Install" item in the Cabinet archives (.cab) context menu

Description.IT: This context menu item, using DISM, allows to simplify the installation of .cab updates with a single click in its context menu. If you have the .cab file extension type associated to open with a third party app (7-Zip, WinRAR, etc...) by default, the "Install" context menu item will not show until you restore the default association for the .cab file type.

Description.IT: By default, the "Open", "Print", "Edit" context menu items will not appear if selecting more than 15 items to avoid accidentally performing these actions on a large number of files.
